summary:
It’s in my blood to be service minded and to act on the customer’s best interests. This was one of the main reasons to study international tourism with my major in international marketing. Eventually I’ve combined two passions: customer interest/service with ICT. Up to the present day I have noticed that I have a different experience of customers than (ex) colleagues that are 100% ICT. I therefore excel on the line between ICT and business and have moved into information security and cyber security (2018). 

I believe in the new leadership where a manager is there to provide guidelines (vision and/or mission), support and coach to let the specialists and professionals excel at their jobs. I will ask the tough and annoying questions to help them see their broader picture of a situation and then let them do what they are good at, what they love, and enjoy.

education.grade: Average of the 6 graduating classing + one supplementary: 7

certifications.name: ITIL  - IT Service Management V2 Foundation

projects.title: Envisioning & implementing hybrid SOC
projects.description: The security monitoring is effectuated based on the MITTRE Att&ck framework to see the coverage and maturity of the SOC. My largest project has been the market investigation to profile a hybrid SOC concept, which was then published and contracted through a European tender. The contracting was completed in December 2022 and the implementation of the hybrid SOC with a large MSSP (Managed Security Service Provider) was initiated in January and completed in October of 2023. During the implementation it turned out that a data orchestrator was required to send the log data to the SIEM of SVB and the MSSP so we purchased and implemented that as well.

projects.title: Implementing PAM (Privileged Access Management) tool
projects.description: During several risk assessments that were done, it became clear that certain high privileged accounts (HPA) were not sufficiently managed and that this risk was beyond the level that was acceptable. I therefore started a project to implemente CyberArk as the PAM (privileged access management) solution to mitigate these large. This was not so much a technical challenge but more a people and processes one, yet it got done. Many accounts were discontinued or downgraded when it came to their privileges, certain accounts were being used for several services which were split up and the remainder were onboarded into CyberArk.

contributors.headline: IT Operations Manager Security & Continuity
internet and intranet administrator at SVB Sociale Verzekeringsbank
IT Security Officer
Senior Product Security Engineer at Dynatrace

projects.title: EKD 5 (Upgrade van Oracle Webcenter Content Manager 11g naar 11g)
projects.description: The EKD (electronic customer dossier, elektronisch klantdossier in Dutch) 5.0 project was the upgrade from UCM 10g to Oracle WebCenter 11g. This meant a transition from AIX to OEL (Oracle Enterprise Linux) and phasing out the GPFS (General Parallel File System) because all the documents in this DMS would be transferred from the file system into the Oracle database itself. This was a huge undertaking with many dependancies of the other applications EKD was linked to, the users using the application and the transfer of 50 TB of documents to the Oracle database.

projects.title: International Student Introduction
projects.description: I was closely involved with the international exchange students and was buddy to several of them. Most of them hadn't been to the Netherlands before and it was my job to show them around within the university compound but also how things work and go in the city of Breda and in the Netherlands generally speaking. I still have contact with many of them who are yet again scattered all over the world.

contributors.headline: IT Operations Manager Security & Continuity

profile_positions.description:
As IT Manager Security & Continuity I am responsible for the teams Security Operations Center (SOC), Monitoring Operations Center (MOC) for the first year, Authorization Management, the technical information security officers (ITSO), and the Release & Deployment Managers including Patch & Upgrade processes. All these teams, 33-35 colleagues in total, strive to make the SVB as cyber resilient as possible and to protect the data of the Dutch civilians as best as we can, based on the 2nd line of defence. 

I work closely with the CISO and her team as well as with other IT managers to constantly monitor the threats, vulnerability, risk, and other relevant reports. As stakeholders, I continuously speak with the business (data & process owners) of the systems that we are protecting. I also have contact within other government bodies to cross reference and share information to the vital infrastructure. 

All information security and privacy protection is risk base and performed based on the policies that the CISO Office puts out which are based on the GDPR (AVG in the Netherlands), ISO27001, NIST, CIS benchmark, as well as other policies and advisories issues by the Dutch national government or its bodies like the Dutch NCSC. 

I was also the HR manager to all the members within the teams of Security & Continuity as the job can’t be done without them. This concerns the coaching and personal development plans for each individual, annual targets, and all other related subjects. As a manager I try to provide structure, guidance, and let the experts and professionals to their job and try to provide an environment in which they can thrive and have the space to experiment.
profile_positions.title: IT Manager Security & Continuity

profile_positions.description: I worked in the CISO Office as a ISO where I was responsible for writing the process to get the SPS (Security & Privacy SVB) policy integrated into Prince2 projects and the definition of done for the Agile/Scrum teams. I also assisted in the awareness training program of the organization, which included training and workshops.
profile_positions.title: Information Security Officer

profile_positions.description: The Middleware section at the SVB consists of approximately 20 fte which are divided in teams develop and support software from Oracle, IBM, Microsoft and several smaller suppliers. Besides the HR responsibilities I was part of several teams as scrum master or product owner when it concerned infrastructural teams within my portfolio. Depending on the service there were also hybrid forms with Agile/Scrum and Prince2.
profile_positions.title: IT Manager Middleware

profile_positions.description: The IS Oracle department at Rabobank is divided into multiple teams; 6 of which are posted teams. I am responsible for the posted employees within these teams that concern themselves with all Oracle Fusion MiddleWare (FMW) applications used within the Rabobank. My teams are responsible for the Oracle products IAM (Identity & Access Management), BPM (Business Process Management), BPEL (Business Process Execution Language), BI (Business Intelligence Suite) and UCM (Universal Content Management/Webcenter Content Manager). I manage the work of 23 infra-specialists in Dev/Ops teams with the functional and technical application managers within the realms of business projects and the continuity of the applications. The operational management is primarily done within the domains, but the end responsibility of the employee management and progression of service is part of my roll. This entails ensuring that the level and quantity of employees within these 6 teams is at the level the domains require. All LCM (lifecycle management) activities on the software is my responsibility, as well as the security checks and activities to provide Rabobank customers with the most stable and secured virtual bank possible in accordance with the rules and regulations set by the Dutch Central Bank (DNB) and European Central Bank (ECB). This position also includes the personnel management responsibilities of the Infra-specialists.
profile_positions.title: Team Manager Oracle Fusion Middleware

profile_positions.description:
I was offered this position by my then manager while still working within the Rabobank as a functional & technical application manager/operator from 2008-2011 (see below) as a natural next-step in my career ladder and in a time when it was became clear to the company that my former team (because of an expanding task field within the department) required dedicated managerial attention. Before my arrival in the department, there were no team leads on any of the teams, including team digital documents. 

As Team lead I was content aware of the services/applications provided and could work as a foreman. This included responsibility to both my team and the KPI’s (departmental goals and targets) and included coaching them on the applications (from junior to senior), how to most well develop their skills (competences) within the confines of company image and policy, customer satisfaction, communication skills (towards customers, end users, project manager and all other concerned parties),and to provide them with the feedback on their development. In general I was responsible for operational and personnel management.

At the end of my time in this position I was contently able to guide and develop my team to becoming a self-sustaining group.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Team Digital Documents

profile_positions.description: As a member of the Sogeti works council I was a representative of the staff interests within the company. This was a position, next to my regular job within Sogeti at Rabobank, that I had been elected for. I would receive and evaluate the documents sent by the board of directors and had monthly meetings with the board of directs, usually the CEO. The largest item on the table during my period within the works counsel was a takeover of an SAP specialized company and the possibility of laying off colleagues due to the economic crisis at the time (if, when and how).
profile_positions.title: Member of Works Council

profile_positions.description: Managing different applications EKD (electronic customer dossier), ICAB RMT ProcesWeb (management tool to control internal bank processes), Planon (scheduling tool for external visitors, meeting rooms, and conference calls), and ID Scanning (tool to physically check customer identification on fraud, theft and other falsifications). In the end I became an expert at UCM (Oracle Webcenter Content Manager, which is a document management tool), ODDC (Oracle Distributed Document Capture, scanning application to digitalize documunts), and IBR (Oracle Inbound Refiner, an application to convert documents to PDF/a which future-proof in respect to accessibility). These applications were used to supply the Rabobank applications EKD, DKV (digital documents towards customers like bank and credit card statements), and GDCI (system designed to send out paper documents to the customers and receive them digitally in the system). To be able to maintain these applications, regular meetings with the business and development administrator’s were required, as well as advising the Change Advisory Board and the Project Boards. All maintenance processes were based on ITIL and projects went from Prince2 and Waterfall and flowed into Agile and DevOps.
profile_positions.title: Technical/Functional Application Manager @ Rabobank Group ICT

profile_positions.description: In this position I was responsible for checking that the agreements made with the customers by the Accountmanager were put into the systems of the ING bank and Postbank correctly. There were many discrepancies that cost the bank or customer a lot of many. This included Euribor interest rates, provisioning dates and other details of the agreements.
profile_positions.title: Wholesale Representative

profile_positions.description: Sales of all products and services T for Telecom offered to consumers. The assortment consisted of all providers of landlines, mobile and cable telephony and internet connections including mobile phones, routers, computers, and accessories.
profile_positions.title: Sales Representative

profile_positions.description: In the absence of the manager, all administrative responsibilities were executed by the assistant manager, which included, but was not limited to: financial administrative work, receiving and assisting guests, and all of the responsibilities of a Reservations Department. During this placement, which was a mandatory portion of my Bachelor’s Studies in Tourism Management, I singly contracted an Internet provider to entitle guests to WiFi throughout the park. I also completed a marketing plan which entailed an extensive update of the website, online booking facilities, which entailed contracting several booking agencies (both online and in-person) to include Parrot Hill to their range.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager (Internship)

profile_positions.description:
During my studies at the NHTV I worked as a bartender in The Thalia Lounge which was a new high end nightclub/dance club in Rotterdam. As a bartender I mixed and served drinks to customers, directly from patrons at the bar, as well as through waiters and waitresses who placed drink orders for customers. I had training to get to know the wide range of drink recipes and be able to mix drinks accurately, quickly, and without waste.

During the day, if I didn’t have any classes, I did administrational work in the office which included counting the cash that came in, made deposits to the bank, create the work rosters, did promotional work, etcetra. I also organized an event called Crave which included marketing, sales, booking DJ’s, obtained sponsors, etcetra.
profile_positions.title: Bartender/Administration

profile_positions.description:
Maintaining in cooperation with business partners, end users, and suppliers the applications crucial to fraud prevention, site contract database, and IPC/ITIL processes.
This included project work and the implementation of new features and updates.
Incident, problem, and change manager accordance to ITIL standards. This included laptop management and the distribution of incident, problem, and change reports to the appropriate departments concurring to their priority. Monitoring the regular report of the KPI’s and IPC processes, and maintaining departmental time-management and the stand-by schedules for internal and managerial usage.
profile_positions.title: Technical Application Manager & ITIL coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Customer complaint and issue resolution pertaining to the full line of mobile products and services offered by Ben Netherlands B.V.

I was also responsible for the development of presentations and the accompanying training portfolios for courses that I lead for new and senior employees of the Customer Service Department at our headquarter locations in The Hague and Breda.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative & Trainer

profile_positions.description: Telephone sales of all KPN consumer products and services relevant to connections for private homes, small businesses, and mobile telephony. [By assignment of Manpower Uitzendbureau]
profile_positions.title: Telephone Sales Representative
